newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Five dead in Tasmanian murder-suicide.
newsitem.headline: Five dead in Tasmanian murder-suicide.

text.p: A middle-aged man murdered his four children and then killed himself in an apparent murder-suicide in the Australian island state of Tasmania, police said on Sunday.

Inspector John Warren said police were called to a house in Cambridge about 15 km (10 miles) east of the capital Hobart on Sunday morning and found the bodies of four children inside a sandstone cottage.
Police said they found the body of a middle-aged man outside an adjacent carpentry workshop. The man appeared to have killed himself after the murders, they said.
"I understand a gun was involved and also another weapon," Inspector Warren told Australian Broadcasting Corp radio.
Further details were not immediately available.

The murder scene was about 50 km north of Port Arthur, where gunman Martin Bryant used now-banned semi-automatic rifles to murder 35 people in April last year in what was Australia's worst modern-day massacre.
